response.original_title: JONAH - The Ultimate Jonah Lomu Full Length Documentary!
response.overview: Jonah Tali Lomu MNZM (12 May 1975 â€“ 18 November 2015) was a New Zealand rugby union player. He became the youngest ever All Black when he played his first international in 1994 at the age of 19 years and 45 days. Playing on the wing Lomu finished his international career with 63 caps and 37 tries. He is regarded as the first true global superstar of rugby and consequently had a huge impact on the game. Lomu was inducted into the International Rugby Hall of Fame on 9 October 2007, and the IRB Hall of Fame on 24 October 2011.
response.title: JONAH - The Ultimate Jonah Lomu Full Length Documentary!
